intro: Schismus barbatus subsp. arabicus, commonly known as the desert spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has a shallow root system and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited to harsh desert environments. Its botanical features reflect its adaptation to extreme conditions, with thick, waxy leaves and a compact growth habit.
